@elpargo any advice for being productive while working from ho

I've been telecommuting for more than 3 years now. It requires some discipline to keep work/personal lives separated -- some people end up working too much and others end up not working. Canonical has a very good guide to working from home (although it's in the internal wiki) and we have many open telecommuting positions: http://www.canonical.com/about-canonical/careers
@sontek when you are in an office you can be idling or just typing nonsense. The "I'm here therefore I'm working" motto is something you want to avoid

The biggest tip I can give you is communication.  When you work in the office everyone knows you are working because they see you sitting in your chair.  When working remote, since they don't see you, they don't know if you are working.

Also, have a workspace still. Don't work from your bed.   Work and personal life start to blend when you do that and you'll find yourself working all day and night since its convenient.  You need to keep the balance or you wont be happy.
@sontek in the very first moment your boss "suggests" it... You should change boss or work.
So even though you could be working harder than ever, the perception could be that you are slacking.
i've been working from home for about 15 years now and part of the "trick" depends on your manager to be honest
if you have a good boss who is already doing a lot of communicating with you then the load is a lot easier

but for sure you have to be proactive in participating in any online activity - which now-a-days is very easy.  it's the little details that will help a lot when you do interact with your co-workers who are at the office.  dress similiar to what you would have worn to the office so when they skype in it doesn't look like you just woke up - stuff like that
